description: A massive lawless slum and junkyard located on the outskirts of Goa Kingdom, just outside the great gate. It's where all the trash and unwanted people from the kingdom are dumped. The area is full of disease, crime, and poverty, with inhabitants searching through garbage to survive.

keyEvents.title: Luffy Discovers Gray Terminal
keyEvents.description: Luffy reaches the edge of the forest and discovers Gray Terminal for the first time, observing the harsh conditions and poverty.
keyEvents.significance: First introduction to this crucial location that represents the dark side of Goa Kingdom.

keyEvents.title: Sabo Introduced at Gray Terminal
keyEvents.description: Sabo is shown working with Ace in Gray Terminal, robbing thieves and pirates.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes Gray Terminal as the base of operations for Ace and Sabo.

keyEvents.title: Luffy Tortured in Gray Terminal
keyEvents.description: Porchemy tortures Luffy in a shack in Gray Terminal, creating one of the darkest moments in the series.
keyEvents.significance: Gray Terminal serves as the setting for Luffy's character-defining moment of endurance and loyalty.

realWorldInspiration: Smokey Mountain in the Philippines, a real-world garbage slum
culturalSignificance: Represents social inequality and how society discards both its waste and its unwanted people to the same place. Gray Terminal symbolizes the hidden poverty behind Goa Kingdom's facade of beauty.

description: A kingdom known as the most beautiful land in the East Blue, but this beauty hides extreme class division. The kingdom dumps all its trash and unwanted people in Gray Terminal outside the walls.

keyEvents.title: Context of Goa Kingdom's Class System
keyEvents.description: Gray Terminal is revealed to be part of Goa Kingdom, showing the dark underbelly of the supposedly beautiful kingdom.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes the social context and class inequality that defines Goa Kingdom.

culturalSignificance: Represents the hypocrisy of society that maintains beauty and order by hiding poverty and inequality out of sight.

name.japanese: グレイ・ターミナル近くの森

description: A forest area near Gray Terminal where Ace and Sabo hide their stolen treasure in a hollow tree. The forest serves as a secret meeting place and storage location.

keyEvents.title: Luffy Discovers Secret Treasure Stash
keyEvents.description: Luffy follows Ace through the forest and discovers the hollow tree where Ace and Sabo hide their treasure.
keyEvents.significance: The discovery location that sets up the episode's main conflict.

keyEvents.title: Luffy Tied to Tree
keyEvents.description: Ace and Sabo tie Luffy to a tree in the forest to prevent him from revealing their treasure location.
keyEvents.significance: The forest becomes the site of the moral dilemma about whether to kill Luffy.

keyEvents.title: Porchemy Finds the Boys
keyEvents.description: Porchemy discovers Ace, Sabo, and Luffy in the forest after hearing Luffy's screams.
keyEvents.significance: The forest becomes the capture site that leads to the torture sequence.

culturalSignificance: Represents a secret refuge and hideout for outcasts and children trying to survive in a harsh world.
